item.title: Mark Zuckerberg faces a jury today. And, the top DHS spokesperson resigns her post
item.description: Mark Zuckerberg takes the stand today in a trial over whether social media companies are fueling the teen mental health crisis. And, Tricia McLaughlin is leaving the Department of Homeland Security.

item.title: Ogden, Schumacher grab silver for U.S. in Olympic cross-country team sprint, Diggins falls short
item.description: U.S. cross-country skiers Ben Ogden and Gus Schumacher power to a silver medal in the men's team sprint. U.S. women led by Jessie Diggins finish off the podium.

item.title: This form of mental exercise may cut dementia risk for decades
item.description: A study finds that people who did one specific form of brain training in the 1990s were less likely to be diagnosed with dementia over the next 20 years.

item.title: State public-option health plans expand but can't fill gaps left by federal changes
item.description: Nevada recently became the third state to offer one of the plans on the ACA marketplaces. They're intended to be a cheaper insurance option but so far they make only a marginal difference in price.
